snippet: The aide, Dmitri S. Peskov, said that Russian intelligence services previously reported plans for the outbreak of protests, implying that a blueprint for unrest was drawn up in Washington.
abstract: Dmitri S Peskov, an aide to Russian Prime Min Vladimir V Putin, says that authorities see the antigovernment protests as evidence of growing demand for political participation, especially among the urban middle class, but reiterates the belief that the United States is playing a role in instigating the demonstrations.
lead_paragraph: The aide, Dmitri S. Peskov, said that Russian intelligence services previously reported plans for the outbreak of protests, implying that a blueprint for unrest was drawn up in Washington.

headline.main: Putin Aide Says Foreign Hands Are Behind Protests
headline.print_headline: Putin Aide Says Foreign Hands Are Behind Protests
